pages.text: Dilophosaurus was a large, carnivorous dinosaur from the Early Jurassic of North America. It had a pair of thin, bony crests on its head, which may have been used for display or to help it cool off. Dilophosaurus was a fast and agile predator, using its sharp teeth and claws to catch small animals. Fossil remains of Dilophosaurus have been found in the Kayenta Formation of Arizona and Utah.
You thought it spat poison? Yeah? Well, you're wrong. It's just a cool dinosaur.
